title: Alabama Beef Systems Videos: How to Collect a Hay Sample

tasks.task: Collecting hay samples and having them analyzed.
subtasks: Operate the forage probe with an electric drill.
Collect samples from each lot of forage.
Insert probe into the hay bale at a 90 degree angle.
For round bales, sample the curved side towards the center.
For square bales, sample the end of the bale in the center.
Empty the probe into a mixing bucket after each bale.
Mix the collected samples thoroughly in the bucket.
Take a sub sample from the mixed bucket, fill it at least half with the mixture.
Place the sub sample into a one quart plastic bag.
Obtain an analysis form from a local source.
Submit both the sample and analysis form to a certified forage testing laboratory.
Wait for the test results, allowing time for the analysis.

tasks.task: Use the test results to create a supplementation plan for livestock.
MAINTASK: Collect hay samples and get them analyzed.
